title.narrative: Promoting Smoke-Free Multi-Unit Housing in Minneapolis

description.narrative: African American (including Somali) and other ethnic minority population children, youth, and young adults living in multi-unit housing

The goal of this project is to reduce harm caused by tobacco among African American (including Somali) and other minority group children, youth, and young adults in Cedar-Riverside, Whittier, Philips, and Elliot Park neighborhoods of Minneapolis, MN. The following four objectives have been laid out to facilitate this goal.
Objective 1: To form a community coalition in key low-income south Minneapolis neighborhoods to advocate for reduction of secondhand smoke exposure and change social norms around tobacco use and exposure.
Objective 2: To implement innovative community awareness and health education activities to decrease secondhand smoke exposure and change social norms around tobacco use and exposure among African American (including Somali) and other minority children, youth, and young adults in key south Minneapolis neighborhoods.
Objective 3: To advocate for smoke-free building policies in 10 multi-unit buildings to decrease secondhand smoke exposure and change social norms around tobacco use and exposure among African American ( including Somali) and other minority children, youth, and young adults in key South Minneapolis neighborhoods.
Objective 4: To plan and advocate for a Minneapolis city ordinance to require smoke-free policies in multi-unit buildings to decrease secondhand smoke exposure and change social norms around tobacco use and exposure
